intro: Laelia × lilacina, commonly known as the lilac orchid, is a hybrid orchid species resulting from the cross between Laelia purpurea and Laelia anceola. It is native to the Andes Mountains in South America, where it thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and ample sunlight. The plant features dense, dark green foliage and produces large, showy flowers in shades of pink, purple, and white. Its pseudobulbs are thick and fleshy, adapted to store water in its native arid climate. Laelia × lilacina is prized by orchid enthusiasts for its striking appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
